name: Operation Blacksmith
description: TTPs identified in Lazarus Group's Operation Blacksmith for espionage on behalf of North Korean government interests

techniques.comment: Initial access begun with successful exploitation of CVE-2021-44228 (Log4Shell) on publicly visible VMWare Horizon servers
Persistence achieved through a '.URL' file in the startup directory that runs a PowerShell command
PowerShell used to download and execute next-stage payload from remote host
Remote Access Trojans DLRAT and NineRAT used for C2 communications; NineRAT's C2 channel implemented on Telegram
Multiple commands (`whoami`, `getmac`, `ver`, etc.), were run for system information discovery
Deployment of custom-made implant 'HazyLoad' on the system after initial reconnaissance for direct access without repeated exploitation
Unauthorized local user account with administrative privileges created for perpetrator use
Credential dumping tools like ProcDump and MimiKatz were utilized for credential harvesting
Use of Telegram by Lazarus to evade network and host-based detection measures; deployment of an additional command-line argument in a PowerShell LNK file to evade anti-virus products
Utilisation of Telegram as an alternative protocol for data exfiltration
Collected data staged for exfiltration on a remote system
Transfer of tools into the compromised environment
Attacks implemented via user-execution of dropped file masqueraded as legitimate
Creation of additional user account with administrative privileges on system
Discovery of user accounts on system
